In 1912, an American Shipping Company launched a new ship called "Titanic". It was the largest and most luxurious ocean liner of the time. It weighed 52,310 tons and could carry about 3327 passengers. Experts said that nothing could make it sink. On April 10, 1912* the ship sailed on its first voyage across the Atlantic. It sailed from Southampton in England to New York in the United States with 2224 passengers of men, women and children.
On April 15, just before midnight, the ship struck a large ice-berg. The ice-berg tore a great hole in the ship's sides and the unsinkable 'Titanic' began to sink. There was a great alarm on board. Warning bells rang out. Eiveryone rushed to the lifeboats, but there was not enough room for them all: There was room for only 1178 passengers. The lifeboats took mostly women and children. It was a terrible scene.

Write a summary of the above passage in your own words.

sub_questions.explanation: In 1912, an American Shipping Company launched the Titanic. It sailed on its maiden voyage from Southampton, England to New York, the USA. Though the ship was thought to be unsinkable, it sank colliding with a huge iceberg while crossing the Atlantic. At the time of sinking, the passengers got panicked and rushed to the lifeboats. However, the lifeboats could take only the women and the children as the number of the boats was limited.

sub_questions.explanation:

Solomon was a prophet as well as king and the greatest justice of his time. Once, two women came  to him to solve a dispute on claiming a child of each  of them. Solomon asked them different questions to  settle the dispute, but it came to nothing. Then, he  used his wit to identify the real mother by ordering a heart rendering order. questions.uddipok:
Answer the following questions to write a paragraph on "A Winter Morning". You should write it in about 150 words.
(a) How is "A Winter Morning"?
(b) Why cann't people see the things from distance in a winter morning?
(c) What do the old people and children do to make themselves warm?
(d) What are the interesting foods of people in a winter morning?
(e) Do you like a winter morning? Why?

sub_questions.explanation:
A Winter Morning
A winter morning has its own exceptional natural aspects as well as its effects on human and animal life. A winter morning is misty and cold. There is dense fog everywhere. Sometimes, the fog is so dense that the sun-rays cannot get through it. Everything looks hazy. The scenery of a winter morning is really charming in rural areas. Dewdrops on grass and leaves sparkle like pearls in the sunrays. Generally, people wake up late in the morning. They shiver in cold. They wear warm clothes. Old people and children are found basking in the morning sun. People usually have date juice and various native 'pithas' as breakfast. Cattle remain in their sheds. However, in cities, a winter morning does not make much change in life as it is not too cold there. People wake up at their usual time, wear colourful warm clothes and go to their work place. Students are seen in the most colourful warm clothes. The nature is dull and gloomy here, too. Both in rural and urban areas, poor people are the worst sufferers. They do not have enough warm clothes to protect themselves from the biting cold. Street children gather straw and papers and make fire to warm themselves. The communication system is disrupted which causes much hardship to the people. However, the scenery of a winter morning is very transitory. It starts disappearing as the day advances. My personal feeling about a winter morning is that it is a bane for the poor, but a boon for the rich.

questions.uddipok:
Read the beginning of a story. Write at least ten new sentences to complete the story and give a title to it.
Once there was a small boy named Bayazid. He was very brilliant and devoted to his mother. One night he was studying by the side of the bed of his mother who was ill. Suddenly his mother woke up and told him to give her a glass of water. But……………

sub_questions.explanation:
Once there was a small boy named Bayazid. He was very brilliant and devoted to his mother. One night he was studying by the side of the bed of his mother who was ill. Suddenly his mother woke up and told him to give her a glass of water. But he found that there was no water in the house.

Without any hesitation, Bayazid took the water pot and went out in search of water. It was a dark and cold night, and everyone was asleep. He walked a long distance to the nearest well. After collecting the water, he hurried back home. But when he reached home, he saw that his mother had fallen asleep again.

Bayazid did not want to wake her up. So, he stood beside her bed with the glass of water in his hand. He remained standing the whole night, waiting patiently for his mother to wake up. When his mother opened her eyes in the morning, she was surprised to see Bayazid standing with the glass of water. Tears came to her eyes, and she hugged her son with love.

Bayazid’s deep love and respect for his mother made him a great man later in life. His story continues to inspire children to honor and care for their pa
rents.

questions.uddipok: Suppose, you are Shihab. Prethu is your friend living in Khulna. You intend to enjoy your summer vacation with Prethu in your own village home where your grandmother is ready to entertain you along with nature's entertainment. Now, write a letter to Prethu inviting him to enjoy summer vacation with you.

sub_questions.explanation:
7 Zindabazar, Sylhet
22 April 2024
My dear Parvez,
Hope you are well by Allah's grace. From your recent letter, I have come to know that your school
is going to be closed for the summer vacation. Our school is also closing for the same purpose. During the summer vacation, I like to visit our village home. You are most welcome to accompany me if you want to pass the summer vacation with me in our village. Therefore, you should reach our
present residence by 25 May. We shall do many interesting things after going to our village home. We shall go to the riverside, pluck fruits from trees and swim in ponds. Apart from this, we shall enjoy jarigan, boat race and what not. All these things will be enjoyable to you.
I hope you will come in time.
Love to all of your family.
Yours ever,
Mahbub

questions.uddipok: We are facing natural calamity this year worsely. Though nature goes its own way, we are mostly responsible for the best use of nature. Now, write a dialogue between you and your friend, Ratul on our responsibility to save the nature.

sub_questions.explanation:
Tamim : Hey Ratul, have you noticed how we're facing more severe natural calamities this year?
Ratul: Yeah, it's really alarming. The floods,storms, and heatwaves are getting worse. It's like nature is fighting back.
Tamim : Absolutely. While nature has its own course, we are mostly for not using it wisely. We need to take the responsibility to save it.
Ratul: Right. We can't just sit back and let things get worse. So, what do you think we should do to help save nature?
Tamim : For starters, we need to reduce our carbon emission. Simple things like using public transport, reducing waste, and conserving energy can make a big difference.
Ratul: Hmm... that makes sense. Also, promoting reforestation is crucial. Trees are essential for maintaining ecological balance.
Tamim : Exactly. We should also be mindful of water usage. With the growing water crisis, conserving water is essential.
Ratul :True. Every drop counts! And raising awareness is equally important.Educating people about the impact of their actions on the environment can lead to more responsible behavior.
Tamim: Absolutely. We can't ignore this anymore. Every small action leads towards a bigger change.
Ratul :Let's start with our community.
Tamim: Alright. Together, we can make a bigdifference. Let's do our part toprotect our planet.
Ratul : Let's do it!
